triples.name: C (programming language)
triples.relevance: The paper formalizes the C programming language semantics, making it the primary subject of formal specification.

triples.name: HOL (proof assistant)
triples.relevance: HOL is the theorem prover used to formally specify and verify the semantics of the C language.

triples.name: Formal semantics
triples.relevance: The paper proposes a formal semantics of C, covering both type systems and dynamic program behavior.

triples.name: Operational semantics
triples.relevance: Structural operational semantics is used to specify transition relations for C expressions, statements, and declarations.

triples.name: Hoare logic
triples.relevance: The paper derives Floyd-Hoare style axiomatic rules from the formal semantics for verifying program properties.

triples.name: Formal verification
triples.relevance: The paper develops formal verification techniques and case studies based on the formalized C semantics.

triples.name: Type system
triples.relevance: Type preservation and type safety properties of C's type system are formally proven in the semantics.
